thread.title: DODGERS: Broadcaster Scully will miss postseason
thread.title_full: DODGERS: Broadcaster Scully will miss postseason - Press Enterprise

author: BILL PLUNKETT
title: DODGERS: Broadcaster Scully will miss postseason
text:
By BILL PLUNKETT / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 8, 2015 Updated: 3:21 p.m. DODGERS: Broadcaster Scully will miss postseason Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Broadcaster Vin Scully underwent a medical procedure Thursday and will miss the Dodgers' postseason. DANNY MOLOSHOK, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Related article » LOS ANGELES – The Dodgers announced that Hall of Fame broadcaster Vin Scully underwent “a recommended medical procedure” Thursday morning and will not work the post-season.
No further details were given regarding the procedure. Scully missed the final series of the regular season last weekend as well due to an illness that was described at the time as a cold. Scully missed another game earlier in the season as well.
Dodgers officials spoke to Scully this week and said he was in good spirits. He is said to be resting comfortably.
With Scully sidelined, Rick Monday and Charley Steiner will broadcast the games on the Dodgers' radio network (570 AM). TBS will telecast all of the Division Series games against the New York Mets.
Scully recently announced that he would return for the 2016 season (with a travel schedule yet to be determined) but he expected that to be his final season. That would be an unprecedented 67 th season as a member of the Dodgers’ broadcast crew.
Scully will turn 88 in late November.
